channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Meta pauses third-party Horizon VR headsets program
item.description: Meta has "paused" its program to license its VR operating system to other hardware companies so they could build their own headsets using the platform, as reported by Road to VR . With the program, announced in April 2024, Meta announced that it would be licensing the Quest OS headset - which, at the same […]

item.title: Democratic lawmakers are investigating data centers’ impact on electricity costs
item.description: Sens. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), Chris Van Hollen (D-MD), and Richard Blumenthal (D-CT) fired off a letter on Tuesday to Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and several major data center developers to investigate the impact they're having on Americans' utility bills. The move comes as rising electricity rates became an increasingly hot-button issue in the US, which […]...

item.title: Australian Surf Crew Captures a Real-Life Ocean ‘Glitch’ That Repeats
item.description: The converging waves swirl until they finally break into a 130-foot pillar of saltwater, in a process that scientists have yet to fully explain.

item.title: Cheddar Lovers, Rejoice: Eating High-Fat Cheese May Lower Dementia Risk
item.description: Cheese can be part of a brain-healthy diet and might even help lower dementia risk, researchers in Sweden have concluded.

item.title: You can snag a pair of the Beats Solo 4 headphones for under $100 right now
item.description: If you’re looking for a gadget to get as a last-minute Christmas gift, we’ve got your back. The Beats Solo 4 are among the best on-ear headphones we’ve tested in the last year or two, and they’re currently down to a new low of $79 ($120 off) in select colors at Walmart. If you prefer […]

item.title: Golf Channel Games 2025 live streams: how to watch golf online for free, teams, stream Scheffler vs McIlory
item.description: All the ways to watch The Golf Channel Games 2025 live streams online and without cable from anywhere, as Team Scottie takes on Team Rory at Trump Jupiter.

item.title: Small talk, phone anxiety and more: Gen Z sounds off on office fears
item.description: Two UK surveys and social media chatter reveal what some of the youngest workers stress out about at work. Gen Z is never beating the “unemployable” allegations.

item.title: Nvidia stock price takes another hit as Wall Street debates an AI bubble. Here’s why it’s down today
item.description: Massive AI spending plans are colliding with fears that the market may be overbuilding too fast. Concerns about an AI bubble and increased competition are weighing on Nvidia as the stock fell to a three-month low on Wednesday.

item.title: YouTube to pull music data from Billboard’s charts because it doesn’t like its ranking formula
item.description: YouTube takes its ball and goes home by pulling Billboard's access to its music data.

item.title: The Warner Brothers-Netflix merger could doom Hollywood film workers
item.description: For media moguls, maximizing shareholder value is the only metric that counts In the months following 2023’s Writers Guild of America (WGA) and Screen Actors Guild–American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) strikes, film-industry workers adopted a refrain: “Survive ‘til ‘25” — a meager goal reflecting industry reality. The strikes came shortly after the Covid-19 pandemic ground production to a halt. The dream factory had become a nightmare....

item.title: America’s Dirtiest Carbon Polluters, Mapped to Ridiculous Precision
item.description: “The U.S. taxpayers have a right to this data.”

item.title: RayNeo X3 Pro Review: These AR Smart Glasses May Haunt My Dreams
item.description: I never want to sideload anything ever again.

item.title: ‘Sense8’ Is a Great Companion Sci-Fi TV Show to ‘Pluribus’
item.description: The sci-fi series from Vince Gilligan and the Wachowskis share themes on the human condition, making for a compelling double feature.

item.title: Amazon has a new leader for its ‘AGI’ group as it plays catch-up on AI
item.description: Amazon's head of artificial general intelligence (AGI), Rohit Prasad, is leaving the company next year as it reaches an "inflection point" in its development of the technology, CEO Andy Jassy announced on Wednesday. As part of the change, Peter DeSantis, a senior vice president at Amazon Web Services, will helm a new division focused on […]

item.title: Texas Sues TV Makers, Claiming They Can Collect Images of What Viewers Are Watching
item.description: Texas AG Ken Paxton claims the companies are "illegally recording Americans’ devices inside their own homes."

item.title: Study links Amazon's algorithmic pricing with erratic, inflated costs for school districts
item.description: When it comes to convenience, it’s hard to beat Amazon. And that rationale isn’t limited to consumers: Many local districts shopping for supplies with public funds apply the same logic. But the Institute for Local Self-Reliance (ILSR) published a study earlier this month (via The American Prospect) that illustrates the cost of that bargain. It suggests that Amazon’s “dynamic pricing” has led many schools and other localities to overpay for supplies.Public schools and local governments have historically bought supplies by soliciting competitive bids from local suppliers. Those vendors then resp...

item.title: Video game hardware sales had a historically bad November in the US
item.description: Spending on video game hardware during November totalled $695 million, a drop of 27 percent compared to last year, according to market analyst company Circana, "This is the lowest video game hardware spending total for a November month since the $455M reached during the November 2005 tracking period," Circana says. In addition, 1.6 million units […]...

item.title: YouTube just won THE Oscars, and the iconic show is set to leave ABC in 2029
item.description: The Oscars are heading to YouTube in 2029. Here's what that means.

item.title: Une étude alerte que des collisions en chaîne de satellites pourrait débuter en 2,8 jours en cas de panne !
item.description: L’orbite terrestre basse ressemble de plus en plus au périphérique parisien aux heures de pointe. Les risques de collision augmentent. Et les scientifiques présente un « cas limite », pas si rare que ça, dont les conséquences pourraient s’étaler sur plusieurs décennies…

item.title: Pénurie de RAM : préparez-vous à payer plus pour avoir la même chose ou pire, à payer plus pour avoir moins
item.description: Entre les centres de données IA qui raflent tout et une pénurie de DRAM qui pourrait durer jusqu'en 2028, le marché du hardware plonge dans une zone de turbulences inédite. C'est votre portefeuille qui va douiller.

item.title: The best Bluetooth trackers for Apple and Android phones
item.description: Some people rarely lose things. Wallets are always exactly where they’re supposed to be, keys never go missing, and remotes never slip between the couch cushions. And then there’s the rest of us — the folks who can’t ever seem to find the thing that was right there a few seconds ago. For us, there […]

item.title: IA appliquée au Québec | SCALE AI investit dans 24 nouveaux projets
item.description: SCALE IA, la grappe canadienne en intelligence artificielle (IA), investira 73,3 millions dans 24 nouvelles initiatives d’IA appliquée au Québec.

item.title: YouTube will stream the Oscars — exclusively — beginning in 2029
item.description: The news highlights YouTube's growing dominance in the television space and a major shift as streaming takes on more live events.

item.title: More than half of workers say they really "love" Excel - and surprisingly enough, it's younger workers who are apparently more infatuated
item.description: Microsoft Excel remains essential across generations, with younger finance professionals embracing its advanced features, while AI integration enhances modern workflow.

item.title: Now there's a robot app store because we all want our bots to kick like Bruce Lee
item.description: Unitree has launched the first known robot app store, which provides canned actions that you can upload or download and add to your robot.

item.title: Meta is pausing its dream of sharing Quest’s Horizon OS with third-party headset makers
item.description: The company said that it would revisit opportunities for third-party partnerships in the future.

item.title: The Best Toys of 2025
item.description: io9's purveyors of plastic joy look back on their favorites of the year, from 'Star Wars' goodness to robot model kits, Lego, and plenty more.

item.title: ‘Non-Political’ Creators Have Outsized Influence on Audience’s Politics, Study Finds
item.description: Measuring the Joe Rogan effect.
